briefTitle: Contraceptive Effectiveness and Safety of the SILCS Diaphragm
officialTitle: Contraceptive Effectiveness and Safety Study of the SILCS Diaphragm: the Pivotal Study
summary: This multi-center contraceptive effectiveness and safety study of the SILCS diaphragm will enroll approximately 450 couples at risk for pregnancy at six study sites in the U.S. The study will randomly assign approximately 300 couples to use the SILCS diaphragm with BufferGel and approximately 150 couples to use the SILCS diaphragm with Gynol II (2% N-9 gel). At two sites, a substudy involving colposcopy and microflora will be conducted in about 80 women (40 at each site). The primary objective of this study is to estimate the cumulative 6-month typical-use pregnancy probability for women using the SILCS diaphragm with a contraceptive gel.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percent Probability of Pregnancy Among Users of the SILCS Diaphragm Used With Contraceptive Gel Over 6 Months of Typical Use
